summary: This is a service request record from August 2019 regarding a failed RAID array in a NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The document details technical support attempts to recover the system, which involved corrupted video data due to improper drive replacement.

persons.name: PRIVAT
persons.context: Made a service call on August 8, 2019, reporting two bad drives on a RAID unit of a NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR at the MCC New York facility. Later called for phone support on August 10th.

persons.name: Senior Support Engineer
persons.context: Provided technical guidance via email on rebuilding the RAID array, including steps to set RAID level to none, replace faulty drives, then set to RAID 5, and initialize.

persons.name: Senior Customer Su Technician
persons.role: Customer support technician at SigNet Technologies
persons.context: Sent an email on February 26, 2019, requesting Pro Unit RAID rebuild documentation from Qognify support.

connections.description: PRIVAT contacted support (implied to be Qognify/Signet) for technical assistance with a failed RAID unit; the Senior Support Engineer provided rebuild instructions.
The technician from SigNet Technologies emailed Qognify support requesting RAID rebuild documentation in February 2019.

events.title: RAID failure reported at MCC New York
events.description: PRIVAT reported a RAID crash showing 2 'Ws' on the display of a NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Phone support and failed drive replacement attempt
events.description: PRIVAT called Signet for phone support while attempting to replace RAID drives. The drives began to rebuild, but improper shutdown corrupted the video database.

events.title: Prior RAID documentation request
events.description: A Senior Customer Support Technician from SigNet Technologies emailed Qognify support requesting Pro Unit RAID rebuild documentation.

locations: 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705
keyFacts: A RAID array failure occurred in a NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on or before August 8, 2019.
The failure involved two bad drives, and an attempt to replace them without proper shutdown corrupted the video database, potentially causing data loss.
The service request indicates the system was at 'FBOP MCC New York', linking it to the Federal Bureau of Prisons facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
Technical support communications reference prior requests for RAID rebuild documentation dating back to February 2019.
The document is a routine IT service record but gains significance due to its location (MCC New York) and timing (August 2019) relative to Epstein's incarceration.
